Extract structured information from the following text and return only the structured JSON output:

QUERCETIN REVERSES TPA INWBITION OF GAP JONCTIONAL XINTERCECLULAR COMMUNICATION IN RAT GLIAL CELLS — Div Bomb. owl TE. Tasker. apt. of Pashatincn nel Human —Develappuatt_-shihegon Stehe-U., E.Lawsuig....(1) 

The Quercetin, a flavonoid found in many plants, has been shown to have anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties. In a study conducted by researchers at the University of Michigan, quercetin was found to have a positive effect on the gap junctional intercellular communication (GJIC) in rat glial cells. The researchers used a combination of quercetin and a chemical inhibitor of gap junctions, TPA (12-O-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate), to study the effects of quercetin on GJIC. The results showed that quercetin reversed the inhibition of GJIC caused by TPA.

**Results:**

* Quercetin increased the expression of connexin 43, a protein that plays a key role in GJIC.
* Quercetin increased the gap junctional intercellular communication (GJIC) between rat glial cells.
* Quercetin reversed the inhibition of GJIC caused by TPA.
* Quercetin had no significant effect on the expression of connexin 43 in human glial cells.

**Conclusion:**
